CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film.

Let's think step by step.

1. The first material name to identify is "PCZDTB". It is mentioned in the phrase "out-of-plane of PCZDTB". PCZDTB seems to be a material or a specific type of thin film.
2. The second material name is "thin film". It is mentioned in the phrase "no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film". Thin film is a general term used to describe a layer of material with a thickness in the order of nanometers to micrometers.

Therefore, the material names in the paragraph are "PCZDTB" and "thin film".
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCZDTB
2. thin film

These are the two material names in the paragraph. I have removed any irrelevant entities.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film.

Let's think step by step.

1. Out-of-plane: This is a property name in the context of describing the orientation or alignment of the PCZDTB thin film.
2. PCZDTB: Although this may not be a traditional property name, it is a specific type of thin film being discussed, so it can be considered a property in this context.
3. Thin film: This is another property name, as it describes the physical form and properties of the PCZDTB material being discussed.

Therefore, the property names in the paragraph are "out-of-plane," "PCZDTB," and "thin film."
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. Thin film: This is a material property, as it describes the physical form and properties of the PCZDTB material being discussed.

Therefore, the only material property in the paragraph is "thin film."
